title: IANA IPv4 Free Pool Exhausted
overview: The Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) allocates the last IPv4 address blocks to the Regional Internet Registries, marking the global depletion of free IPv4 space.

title: APNIC IPv4 Exhaustion
overview: The Asia-Pacific Network Information Centre (APNIC) becomes the first RIR to exhaust its IPv4 pool, triggering IPv4 trading and secondary markets in the region.

title: ARIN IPv4 Exhaustion
overview: The American Registry for Internet Numbers (ARIN) officially runs out of IPv4 addresses, accelerating demand for transfers and leasing.

title: RIPE NCC IPv4 Exhaustion
overview: RIPE NCC announces it has allocated the last IPv4 addresses from its free pool, intensifying the market for IPv4 buying, selling, and leasing in Europe.

title: Scarcity at LACNIC & AFRINIC
overview: IPv4 scarcity reaches LACNIC and AFRINIC, with strict allocation policies and growing demand pushing prices upward.

title: IPv4 Leasing Goes Mainstream
overview: IPv4 leasing becomes a widely adopted market practice, providing flexible access to addresses for cloud, ISPs, and enterprises.

title: IPv4 Prices Spike
overview: IPv4 address prices surpass $50 per IP in some regions, reflecting scarcity and strong demand across cloud and enterprise networks.

title: Dual-Stack Reality
overview: Despite IPv6 adoption, dual-stack operation remains the global norm, reinforcing IPv4â€™s enduring market value and ongoing leasing/trading practices.
